extraction_metadata.title: Global conservation outcomes depend on marine protected areas with five key features

entities_extracted.definition: Five key features that determine marine protected area conservation success

I.name: Isolated
I.definition: Deep water or sand barriers limiting edge effects

entities_extracted.source_quote: Conservation benefits of individual MPAs increase in relation to five key features: being no-take, well-enforced, old (>10 years), large (>100 km2), and isolated by deep water or sand.

entities_extracted.description: Fish biomass inside vs outside MPAs based on NEOLI criteria

neoli_5_criteria.interpretation: MPAs meeting all 5 criteria have 670% higher biomass

neoli_4_criteria.interpretation: MPAs meeting 4 criteria have 450% higher biomass

neoli_3_criteria.interpretation: MPAs meeting 3 criteria have 280% higher biomass

neoli_1_2_criteria.interpretation: MPAs meeting 1-2 criteria show minimal benefit

entities_extracted.source_quote: MPAs with no fishing and four additional key features have fish biomass levels 670% higher than fished areas

entities_extracted.description: Standardized fish surveys across 87 marine protected areas worldwide

relationships_extracted.subject: NEOLI_criteria
relationships_extracted.source_quote: Our results demonstrate that conservation outcomes across all MPAs are not universal, but depend critically on the presence of five key features

bridge_axiom_support.notes: This paper is the primary source for NEOLI criteria and provides the foundation for BA-002

key_quotes.quote: Conservation benefits of individual MPAs increased exponentially with the accumulation of five key features
key_quotes.relevance: Core finding on NEOLI cumulative effects

key_quotes.quote: Large (>100 km2) fully protected (no-take) areas that are well enforced and have been established for more than 10 years show the greatest conservation benefits
Fish biomass in MPAs meeting all five criteria averaged 670% of biomass in fished sites

provenance.confidence_assessment: high - seminal paper with clear methodology
